instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2251: What is A2251? A2251 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3348, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01949..
definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no power.

It had water contact on the USB-C conector, and stoped working.

All USB-C ports were consuming 5.26V and 0.25A, with exception of <SIGNAL>U3100_X</SIGNAL>, that was pulling 0A. After replaceing <SIGNAL>U3100_X</SIGNAL>, now that port also pulls 0.25A, but all ports only have 5.26V

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Did you check <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> LDOs?
Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CBC_ON</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>U3100_X</SIGNAL> diode readings:

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_X_LDO</SIGNAL> =  0.510
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_UPC_LDO_CORE_X</SIGNAL> = 0.523
<SIGNAL>USBC_X_CC1</SIGNAL> = 0.590
<SIGNAL>USBC_X_CC2</SIGNAL> = 0.590

<SIGNAL>U3100_T</SIGNAL> diode readings:

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_T_LDO</SIGNAL> = 0.511
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_UPC_LDO_CORE_T</SIGNAL> = 0.525
<SIGNAL>USBC_T_CC1</SIGNAL> = 0.590
<SIGNAL>USBC_T_CC2</SIGNAL> = 0.591

<SIGNAL>U3100_R</SIGNAL> diode readings:

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_R_LDO</SIGNAL> = 0.515
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_UPC_LDO_CORE_R</SIGNAL> = 0.527
<SIGNAL>USBC_R_CC1</SIGNAL> = 0.588
<SIGNAL>USBC_R_CC2</SIGNAL> = 0.586

<SIGNAL>U3100_W</SIGNAL> diode readings:

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_W_LDO</SIGNAL> = 0.507
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_UPC_LDO_CORE_W</SIGNAL> = 0.529
<SIGNAL>USBC_W_CC1</SIGNAL> = 0.597
<SIGNAL>USBC_W_CC2</SIGNAL> = 0.597

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages:

<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>  = 1.282V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>  = 0V
VDDA = 5.150V
VDDP  = 5.140V
<SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>  = 5.150V
AMON = 0.050V
BMON = 0V
<SIGNAL>CBC_ON</SIGNAL> = couldn't find where to measure it. Can you help?
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> = couldn't find where to measure it. Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> = couldn't find where to measure it."
Use the logic when you work; can't find <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
How did you find other signals?
Don't bother with it now; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> is good, if get VDDA/P.

I was expecting voltage readings for <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> LDOs.
Do you get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at least?

Check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>J3300_CXT</SIGNAL>/CWR pins and compare with good board.
Or compare at least left/right sides.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message: <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> could also cause the this board to be stuck at 5v. I had one with the same issue as you, and did not get 20v until I replaced <SIGNAL>U2800_X</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>U2800_T</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
" Use the logic when you work; can't find <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>? "
Sorry, my bad.

All <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> LDO´s have the right voltages (1.5V and 3.3V)
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.29V

I don't have a good board to compare diode readings, but comparing connectors on both conectors, all readings are identical

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Try DFU.
Lets see if is recognized in AC2 at least.
AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages must come on.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

The DFU revive worked. It boots again. However, it is not charging the battery. It pulls 20V but 0A from ampmeter.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message: Does it work with charger alone (without battery)?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
No it doesn't. With the battery disconected it only pulls 5.16V.

Now that the battery went gone, it don't power on.

With the battery conected it puls 20V, 0A from ampmeter but no power on.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL>.
If low, you have a problem on USB-C area.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

<RESISTOR>R3208</RESISTOR>/9 had normal resistance values (1M ohm) but had small bit of corrosion, and after replace them, the mac started to work normnally.

TKS!
